title.text: Book Reviews Intelligent Multimedia Interfaces "Automating the generation of coordinated multimedia explanations" "Towards coordinated temporal multimedia presentations" "Multimedia explanations for intelligent training systems" Section 2: Intelligent Multimedia Interfaces

abstractContent.text: Of interest to computational linguists is the fact that natural language, discourse, and planning research have a much greater presence here than in the previous installment of this line of workshops.

A comparable collection of papers, Intelligent User Interfaces (Sullivan and Tyler 1991), emerged from a 1988 AAAI/CHI workshop named Architectures for Intelligent Interfaces: Elements and Prototypes.

By my informal, ad hoc count, about half of the papers in the earlier collection had something to do with the AI side of computational linguistics, whereas all but perhaps two of the papers in Maybury's volume do.
The work is divided into three sections.
